channel.title: Comments on: What Google+ Looks Like For Me

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/06/29/what-google-looks-like-for-me/#comment-3764">Joe</a>.
Just playing the waiting game now, hoping it comes sooner rather than later.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joe.

Just playing the waiting game now, hoping it comes sooner rather than later.

item.title: By: Joe
item.dc:creator: Joe
item.description:
I'm in the same boat. Profiles are supposed to be coming for your domain... you can sign up here to be notified.
http://googleenterprise.blogspot.com/2011/03/coming-soon-to-google-apps-1-button-and.html
item.content:encoded:
I’m in the same boat. Profiles are supposed to be coming for your domain… you can sign up here to be notified.

http://googleenterprise.blogspot.com/2011/03/coming-soon-to-google-apps-1-button-and.html

item.title: By: Sahas Katta
item.dc:creator: Sahas Katta
item.description:
Let me know if anyone finds the setting to enable Google+. I've been waiting eagerly to get it work with my Google App account. I have a regular Gmail account to test it too, but I'd rather not build a whole social network with friends on an account I don't use.
I just hope a year doesn't go by without them enabling the feature as it happened for Google Buzz.
item.content:encoded:
Let me know if anyone finds the setting to enable Google+. I’ve been waiting eagerly to get it work with my Google App account. I have a regular Gmail account to test it too, but I’d rather not build a whole social network with friends on an account I don’t use.

I just hope a year doesn’t go by without them enabling the feature as it happened for Google Buzz.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/06/29/what-google-looks-like-for-me/#comment-3761">kavin</a>.
I'm hearing that they are working on it, but still no luck for my account.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to kavin.

I’m hearing that they are working on it, but still no luck for my account.

item.title: By: kavin
item.dc:creator: kavin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/06/29/what-google-looks-like-for-me/#comment-3759">Joseph Scott</a>.
Looks like the issue is resolved now. I can now login into profiles with apps account.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

Looks like the issue is resolved now. I can now login into profiles with apps account.

item.title: By: Rev. Voodoo
item.dc:creator: Rev. Voodoo
item.description: I'm in the same boat. Apps doesn't support profiles. If some lucky peeps got through, Wow, that's cool for them! I spent I dunno how much time converting analytics over from @gmail to my apps. I closed my adsense to restart it. Got pretty much everything done except youtube which won't switch over. I can open a new one on my apps account, but not transfer. And then the profile/google+ thing.
item.content:encoded: I’m in the same boat. Apps doesn’t support profiles. If some lucky peeps got through, Wow, that’s cool for them! I spent I dunno how much time converting analytics over from @gmail to my apps. I closed my adsense to restart it. Got pretty much everything done except youtube which won’t switch over. I can open a new one on my apps account, but not transfer. And then the profile/google+ thing.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/06/29/what-google-looks-like-for-me/#comment-3758">kavin</a>.
Yep, migrating Apps accounts to real accounts has done strange things.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to kavin.

Yep, migrating Apps accounts to real accounts has done strange things.

item.title: By: kavin
item.dc:creator: kavin
item.description: Facing the same problem. Did you upgrade/migrate the apps recently, when you were notified to do so? I missed it, now i cant login anywhere with my google apps domain acc(StackOverflow.. etc..)
item.content:encoded: Facing the same problem. Did you upgrade/migrate the apps recently, when you were notified to do so? I missed it, now i cant login anywhere with my google apps domain acc(StackOverflow.. etc..)

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/06/29/what-google-looks-like-for-me/#comment-3756">Josef</a>.
I tried, there is no option on the services list for Google Profiles or Google+.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Josef.

I tried, there is no option on the services list for Google Profiles or Google+.

item.title: By: Josef
item.dc:creator: Josef
item.description:
Did you poke around the management settings?
Here's how you enable/disable the services. I'm not sure if the profile thingy is one, but it's your best bet: http://www.google.com/support/a/bin/answer.py?answer=182442
item.content:encoded:
Did you poke around the management settings?

Here’s how you enable/disable the services. I’m not sure if the profile thingy is one, but it’s your best bet: http://www.google.com/support/a/bin/answer.py?answer=182442
